entry.title: Business Week Armenia: Armenia leads region in economic growth

media:group.media:title: Business Week Armenia: Armenia leads region in economic growth
media:group.media:description:
In this week‚Äôs edition of CivilNet‚Äôs weekly business digest, we take a look back at how Armenia‚Äôs economy fared last year ‚Äî and what we can expect in the coming one. We also explore the Central Bank‚Äôs decision this week not to raise its refinancing rate further, as well as the annual list of Armenia‚Äôs top taxpayers.
üìçArmenia‚Äôs economic activity index tops 14% in 2022 üìçCentral Bank leaves key rate unchanged as inflation eases üìçMining, energy, tobacco firms dominate top taxpayers list üìçCentral Bank head predicts over 4% growth in 2023

entry.title: Karabakh blockade deprives 20,000 children of right to education

media:group.media:title: Karabakh blockade deprives 20,000 children of right to education
media:group.media:description:
As Azerbaijan‚Äôs blockade of the only road connecting Armenia and Nagorno-Karabakh stretches beyond its 50th day, schools in the region are being forced to close their doors to about 20,000 students. Breadlines too have been forming in Stepanakert. Due to the lack of power, bakeries cannot keep up with demand, and once a fresh batch is ready, residents are quick to buy whatever‚Äôs available. In response to all of this, a group of women co-signed a letter addressed to European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, calling for the EU to take action to lift the blockade.

entry.title: CSTO mission to Armenia still on the table, insists Russian foreign minister

media:group.media:title: CSTO mission to Armenia still on the table, insists Russian foreign minister
media:group.media:description:
U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken appointed senior foreign service officer Louis Bono as Washington‚Äôs new senior advisor for Caucasus negotiations and Minsk Group co-chair.¬† A proposal from the CSTO, a Russian-led military alliance, to deploy a mission to the Armenia-Azerbaijan border is still on the table, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said. The Armenian government approved plans to introduce a new comprehensive health insurance system in the country.
